newsitem.title: SPAIN: Spanish police crush money-laundering ring.
newsitem.headline: Spanish police crush money-laundering ring.

text.p: Spanish police said on Thursday they had crushed an international money-laundering operation suspected of processing more than $230 million in the last three years, most of it from trade in illegal drugs.
In an operation dubbed "Mosque", police arrested seven people at various locations in southern Spain, two of them Moroccans living in a wealthy suburb of Marbella.
The organisation used companies which dealt in precious metals set up in Gibralter and other tax havens as fronts for moving money internationally, police said.
